title: Manuel Gutiérrez Aragón
text:
Manuel Gutiérrez Aragón (<a href="Torrelavega">Torrelavega</a>, <a href="Cantabria">Cantabria</a> 2 January 1940) is a Spanish screenwriter and film director. His 1973 film "<a href="Habla%2C%20mudita">Habla, mudita</a>" was entered into the <a href="23rd%20Berlin%20International%20Film%20Festival">23rd Berlin International Film Festival</a>. In 1977, he won the <a href="Silver%20Bear%20for%20Best%20Director">Silver Bear for Best Director</a> for "<a href="Black%20Litter">Camada negra</a>" at the <a href="27th%20Berlin%20International%20Film%20Festival">27th Berlin International Film Festival</a>. His 1979 film "<a href="Heart%20of%20the%20Forest">El corazón del bosque</a>" was entered into the <a href="29th%20Berlin%20International%20Film%20Festival">29th Berlin International Film Festival</a>. Two years later, his film "<a href="Maravillas%20%28film%29">Maravillas</a>" was entered into the <a href="31st%20Berlin%20International%20Film%20Festival">31st Berlin International Film Festival</a>. His 1982 film "<a href="Demons%20in%20the%20Garden">Demons in the Garden</a>" was entered into the <a href="13th%20Moscow%20International%20Film%20Festival">13th Moscow International Film Festival</a> where it won the <a href="International%20Federation%20of%20Film%20Critics">FIPRESCI Prize</a>. In 1991 he was a member of the jury at the <a href="17th%20Moscow%20International%20Film%20Festival">17th Moscow International Film Festival</a>.
In 1995 his film "<a href="King%20of%20the%20River%20%28film%29">King of the River</a>" was entered into the <a href="45th%20Berlin%20International%20Film%20Festival">45th Berlin International Film Festival</a>.
Gutiérrez Aragón was elected to Seat "F" of the <a href="Real%20Academia%20Espa%C3%B1ola">Real Academia Española</a> on 16 April 2015, he took up his seat on 24 January 2016.
